heading: welcome to tune town
subheading: download music, check tour dates, buy a ticket and a t-shirt. cranberry grove promises one-stop shopping for digital music lovers.
author: lakshmi chaudhry
text: cranberry grove is bringing together tunes.com, magex, and intertrust technologies to provide a comprehensive e-commerce web site for digital music consumers.still in its initial phase, cranberry grove is not yet open to the public. participation is currently limited to 5,000 music and online industry veterans who are test-driving the site to make sure it's secure and easy to use, said chris henger, tunes.com's director of business development.using intertrust's meta trust certified players, consumers will be able to securely download music, purchase concert tickets, and, eventually, music-related souvenirs like t-shirts.the tunes.com internet music network will provide ticket and tour information through its rollingstone.com site. with a click of the mouse, users can access tour information and buy tickets from ticketmaster.a new digital commerce service from natwest, called magex, will act as a financial intermediary, collecting money from customers and distributing revenues to the record labels, artists, and ticket agencies, said glen jennison, magex's head of it and operations.collaborations like cranberry grove offer a way for banks like natwest to enter the rapidly expanding universe of online commerce."we got into music because it seemed to be a key driver at the moment," jennison said.
